content: the needles for ease of knitting place a marker on the left end of needle #1 then slide 12 instep sts off of needle #2 from the right hand side of the instep onto needle #1 then with needle #2 knit 7 heel sts from needle #1 on needle #1 you will have 7 heel sts 12 gusset sts and 12 instep sts needle #2 will have 12 instep sts 12 gusset sts and 7 heel sts the sock will be divided in half side to side the markers are between the instep and gusset sts continue as follows round 1 knit keeping instep sts in established ribbing pattern round 2 starting with needle #1 knit to 3 sts before marker #1 k2 decrease k1 slip marker work in established rib across instep with needle #2 work in established rib across instep slip marker k1 ssk k to end of round repeat round 1 and round 2 until there are 24 sts on each needle 48 sts total foot continue in st st on the foot bed and k2 p2 ribbing on the instep until 2 less than desired foot length toe shaping knit one round repositioning the needles so that the foot bed sts are on needle #1 and instep sts are on needle #2 the sock is now divided in half front to back end so that you will begin knitting on needle #2 work toe decreases as follows round 1 starting with needle #2 k1 ssk k to 3 sts before end of needle k2 decrease k1 with needle #1 k1 ssk k to 3 sts before end of needle k2 decrease k1 round 2 knit all sts repeat round 1 and round 2 until there are 6 sts left on each needle 12 sts total remaining finishing graft toe sts together weave in ends ©2010 for personal use only
